analyzed: evam nibbāna nagaram paṭhamam āvāsitam tatas sampuṇṇam nagaram ti pucchitvā na tāva ati
translated: and the time when the city of Nibbāna was first inhabited, and then was filled, and after it was said: “Not yet,”

original: vutte pañca kulāni ādiṃ katvā yāva caturāsītikulasahassapesanaṃ viya tathāgatassa
analyzed: vutte pañca kulāni ādim katvā yāva catur āsīti kula sahassa pesanam viya tathāgatassa
translated: like the time when the five families were made the beginning and the teaching was extended as far as eighty-four thousand families,

original: pañcamadivasato paṭṭhāya anattalakkhaṇasuttādīni desetvā pañcavaggiye ādiṃ katvā
analyzed: pañcama divasataḥ paṭṭhāya anatta lakkhaṇa sutta ādīni desetvā pañcavaggiye ādim katvā
translated: and the time when, after the Tathāgata, beginning from the fifth day, taught the Anattalakkhaṇa Sutta and so on,

original: yasapamukhā pañcapaṇṇāsa kulaputtā, tiṃsa bhaddavaggiyā, sahassapurāṇajaṭilā, bimbisārapamukhāni
analyzed: yasapamukhā pañcapaṇṇāsa kula puttā tiṃsa bhaddavaggiyā sahassapurāṇajaṭilā bimbisāra pamukhāni
translated: and the fifty-five young men headed by Yasa, the thirty good men, the one thousand ancient dreadlocked ascetics, and the Bimbisāra-headed

original: ekādasapurisanahutāni, tirokuṭṭānumodane caturāsītisahassānīti ettakassa janassa
analyzed: ekādasa purisa nahutāni tirokuṭṭa anumodane catur āsīti sahassāni iti ettakassa janassa
translated: and 11,000 people at the exhortation in the open space in front of the gateway, and 84,000 at the exhortation after crossing the threshold.

original: ariyamaggaṃ otāretvā nibbānanagaraṃ pesitakālo, atha tena nayena nagare apūriyamāne
analyzed: ariya maggam otāretvā nibbāna nagaram pesita kālaḥ atha tena nayena nagare a pūriyamāne
translated: After he had thus caused that number of people to enter the Noble Path and sent them to the city of Nibbāna, the city was not filled.🔽Then, when the city was not filled in this way,

original: bheriṃ carāpetvā nagarassa vaṇṇaghosanaṃ kulānaṃ parihāralābhaghosanaṃ viya ca māsassa
analyzed: bherim cara āpetvā nagarassa vaṇṇa ghosanam kulānam parihāra lābha ghosanam viya ca māsassa
translated: he had a proclamation made with the beating of drums, just as a proclamation is made of the beauty of the city and the gain to be got from the distribution of alms,

original: aṭṭha divase tattha tattha nisīditvā dhammakathikānaṃ nibbānavaṇṇassa ceva nibbānappattānaṃ🔽jātikantārādinittharaṇānisaṃsassa ca ghosanaṃ, tato sabbadisāhi āgantvā manussānaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭha divase tattha tattha nisīditvā dhamma kathikānam nibbāna vaṇṇassa ca iva nibbāna ppattānam  jāti kantāra ādi nittharaṇa anisaṃsassa ca ghosanam tatas sabba disāhi āgantvā manussānam
translated: and he had the preachers of the Dhamma sit down in various places and proclaim the benefits of the escape from the desert of births and deaths and the praise of Nibbāna,🔽just as people come from all directions to enter the city. Then, after hearing the Dhamma preached in various places,

original: nagarasamosaraṇaṃ viya tattha tattha dhammakathaṃ sutvā tato tato nikkhamitvā pabbajjaṃ
analyzed: nagara samosaraṇam viya tattha tattha dhamma katham sutvā tatas tatas nikkhamitvā pabbajjam
translated: just as people go out from the city in all directions to enter the city, so the countless clansmen who went forth into homelessness, beginning with the group of five, and entered upon the right way of practice,

original: ādiṃ katvā anulomapaṭipadaṃ paṭipannānaṃ aparimāṇānaṃ kulaputtānaṃ nibbānasamosaraṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: ādim katvā anuloma paṭipadam paṭipannānam aparimāṇānam kula puttānam nibbāna samosaraṇam daṭṭhabbam
translated: should be regarded as entering Nibbāna.

original: Purāṇaṃ magganti ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ. Ayañhi ariyamaggo pavāraṇasutte avattamānakaṭṭhena
analyzed: purāṇam magganti ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam ayam hi ariya maggaḥ pavāraṇa sutte avattamāna kaṭṭhena
translated: The ancient path is the Noble Eightfold Path. For this Noble Path is called “the unmade path” in the Pava- raṇasutta,

original: “anuppannamaggo”ti vutto, imasmiṃ sutte avaḷañjanaṭṭhena “purāṇamaggo”ti. Brahmacariyanti🔽sikkhattayasaṅgahaṃ sakalasāsanaṃ. Iddhanti jhānassādena samiddhaṃ subhikkhaṃ. Phītanti
analyzed: anuppanna maggo ti vuttaḥ imasmin sutte avaḷañjana ṭṭhena purāṇa maggo ti brahmacariyanti  sikkhattaya saṅgaham sakala sāsanam iddhanti jhāna ssādena samiddham subhikkham phītanti
translated: and it is called “the ancient path” in this sutta in the sense of not being newly made. The holy life is the whole dispensation of the three trainings.🔽Prosperous means rich with the wealth of jhana. Flourishing means adorned with the flowers of direct knowledge.

original: abhiññābharaṇehi pupphitaṃ. Vitthārikanti vitthiṇṇaṃ. Bāhujaññanti bahujanaviññeyyaṃ.🔽Yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitanti yāva dasasahassacakkavāḷe devamanussehi paricchedo
analyzed: abhiññā ābharaṇehi pupphitam vitthārikanti vitthiṇṇam bāhujaññanti bahu jana viññeyyam  yāva deva manussehi su pakāsitanti yāva dasa sahassa cakkavāḷe deva manussehi paricchedaḥ
translated: Extensive means spread out. Well known means known to the multitude.

original: atthi, etasmiṃ antare suppakāsitaṃ sudesitaṃ tathāgatenāti. Pañcamaṃ.
analyzed: atthi etasmin antare suppakāsitam su desitam tathāgatena ati pañcamam
translated: Well proclaimed means well proclaimed, well taught, by the Tathāgata as far as there are gods and men.🔽The fifth sutta.

original: 6. Sammasasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sammasa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Sammasasutta.

original: 66. Chaṭṭhe āmantesīti kasmā āmantesi? Yasmāssa sukhumā tilakkhaṇāhatā dhammadesanā
analyzed: chaṭṭhe āmantesi iti kasmai āmantesi yasmai assa sukhumā ti lakkhaṇa āhatā dhamma desanā
translated: In the sixth sutta, he addressed them: why did he address them? Because his subtle teaching of the Dhamma,

original: upaṭṭhāsi. Tasmiṃ kira janapade manussā sahetukā paññavanto. Siniddhāni kirettha
analyzed: tasmin kira janapade manussā sa hetukā paññavantaḥ siniddhāni kira ittha
translated: which was pounded by the three characteristics, was successful. For in that country, it seems, the people were wise and had a good grasp of the meaning.

original: bhojanāni, tānisevato janassa paññā vaḍḍhati, te gambhīraṃ tilakkhaṇāhataṃ dhammakathaṃ
analyzed: bhojanāni tāni sevataḥ janassa paññā vaḍḍhati te gambhīram ti lakkhaṇa āhatam dhamma katham
translated: and the wisdom of those who use them increases. They are able to penetrate the deep Dhamma talk that is stamped with the three characteristics.

original: paṭivijjhituṃ samatthā honti. Teneva bhagavā dīghamajjhimesu mahāsatipaṭṭhānāni mahānidānaṃ,
analyzed: paṭivijjhitum samatthāḥ honti tena iva bhagavā dīgha majjhimesu mahā sati paṭṭhānāni mahā nidānam
translated: That is why the Blessed One preached the long and medium Dhammacakkappavattanas, the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna, the Mahānidāna,

original: āneñjasappāyaṃ, saṃyuttake cūḷanidānādisuttanti evamādīni aññāni gambhīrāni suttāni
analyzed: āneñja sappāyam saṃyuttake cūḷa nidāna ādi suttanti evamādīni aññāni gambhīrāni suttāni
translated: the Āneñjasappāya, the Saṃyutta Cūḷanidāna, and other deep suttas right there.

original: tattheva kathesi. Sammasatha noti sammasatha nu. Antaraṃ sammasanti abbhantaraṃ paccayasammasanaṃ.
analyzed: tattha iva kathesi sammasatha no ti sammasatha nu antaram sammasanti abbhantaram paccaya sammasanam
translated: “Contemplate”: “Contemplate” = “Contemplate now.” They contemplate the inside, the outside, and the inside-and-outside.

original: Na so bhikkhu bhagavato cittaṃ ārādhesīti paccayākāravasena byākārāpetukāmassa bhagavato
analyzed: na saḥ bhikkhu bhagavataḥ cittam ārādhesi iti paccaya ākāra vasena byākāra apetu kāmassa bhagavataḥ
translated: “That bhikkhu did not please the Blessed One’s mind” : the Blessed One wanted him to explain by way of the principles of conditionality,

original: tathā abyākaritvā dvattiṃsākāravasena byākaronto ajjhāsayaṃ gahetuṃ nāsakkhi.
analyzed: tathā a byākaritvā dvattiṃsa ākāra vasena byākarontaḥ ajjhāsayam gahetum na asakkhi
translated: but he explained by way of the thirty-two aspects and so was unable to grasp the Blessed One’s intention.

original: Etadavocāti desanā yathānusandhiṃ na gatā, desanāya yathānusandhigamanatthaṃ etadavoca.
analyzed: etat avoca ati desanā yathā anusandhim na gatā desanāya yathā anusandhi gamana attham etat avoca
translated: “This he said”: the teaching did not go according to the sequence; he said this in order to make the teaching go according to the sequence.

original: Tenahānanda, suṇāthāti idaṃ tepiṭake buddhavacane asambhinnapadaṃ. Aññattha hi evaṃ
analyzed: tena ha ānanda suṇātha ati idam tepiṭake buddha vacane asambhinna padam hi evam
translated: “Therefore, Ananda, listen well” : this is a phrase in the Tipitaka, the Buddha’s word, that is not found elsewhere.

original: vuttaṃ nāma natthi. Upadhinidānanti khandhupadhinidānaṃ. Khandhapañcakañhettha upadhīti
analyzed: vuttam nāma natthi upadhi nidānanti khandha upadhi nidānam khandha pañcakam ha ittha upadhi iti
translated: “With attachment as condition” : with the attachment of the five aggregates as condition. For here the five aggregates are intended by the word “attachment.”

original: adhippetaṃ. Uppajjatīti jāyati. Nivisatīti punappunaṃ pavattivasena patiṭṭhahati.
analyzed: adhippetam uppajjati iti jāyati nivisati iti punappunam pavatti vasena patiṭṭhahati
translated: “Arises” : is born. “Comes into play” : it is established by the process of repeated occurrence.

original: Yaṃ kho loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpanti yaṃ lokasmiṃ piyasabhāvañceva madhurasabhāvañca.🔽Cakkhuṃ loketiādīsu lokasmiñhi cakkhādīsu mamattena abhiniviṭṭhā sattā sampattiyaṃ
analyzed: yam khalu loke piya rūpam yam lokasmin piya sabhāvam ca iva madhu rasa bhāvam ca  cakkhum loka iti ādīsu lokasmin hi cakkha ādīsu mamattena abhiniviṭṭhā sattā sampattiyam
translated: “Whatever is pleasing and delightful” : whatever has the nature of being pleasing and delightful in the world.

original: patiṭṭhitā attano cakkhuṃ ādāsādīsu nimittaggahaṇānusārena vippasannapañcapasādaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhitā attano cakkhum ādāsa ādīsu nimitta ggahaṇa anusārena vippasanna pañca pasādam
translated: “The eye in the world” : beings who are attached to the eye, etc., in the world by the conceit “I am,” who are established in the attainment of the five aggregates, think that their eye is clear with the five kinds of vision, like a bejewelled window in a golden palace, following the apprehension of signs in the mirror, etc.🔽They think that the ear is like a silver trumpet,

original: suvaṇṇavimāne ugghāṭitamaṇisīhapañjaraṃ viya maññanti, sotaṃ rajatapanāḷikaṃ viya🔽pāmaṅgasuttaṃ viya ca maññanti, tuṅganāsāti laddhavohāraṃ ghānaṃ vaṭṭetvā ṭhapitaharitālavaṭṭiṃ
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vimāne ugghāṭita maṇi sīha pañjaram viya maññanti sotam rajata panāḷikam viya 🔽pāmaṅga suttam viya ca maññanti tuṅga nāsā ati laddha vohāram ghānam vaṭṭetvā ṭhapita haritāla vaṭṭim
translated: and the nose, which is called “high-bridged,” is like a betel leaf placed on a stick,

original: viya maññanti, jivhaṃ rattakambalapaṭalaṃ viya mudusiniddhamadhurarasadaṃ maññanti,
analyzed: viya maññanti jivham ratta kambala paṭalam viya mudu siniddha madhura rasa dam maññanti
translated: They think of the tongue as a piece of red cloth, soft, smooth, and sweet-tasting.

original: kāyaṃ sālalaṭṭhiṃ viya suvaṇṇatoraṇaṃ viya ca maññanti, manaṃ aññesaṃ manena asadisaṃ uḷāraṃ maññanti.🔽Niccato addakkhunti niccanti addasaṃsu. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Na parimucciṃsu
analyzed: kāyam sāla laṭṭhim viya suvaṇṇa toraṇam viya ca maññanti manam aññesam manena asadisam uḷāram maññanti  niccatas sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ na
translated: They think of the body as a post of sāla wood or a golden pillar. They think of the mind as something lofty and not to be compared with the minds of others.

original: dukkhasmāti sakalasmāpi vaṭṭadukkhā na parimucciṃsu. Dakkhissantīti passissanti.
analyzed: dukkhasma ati sakalasma api vaṭṭa dukkhā na parimucciṃsu dakkhissanti iti passissanti
translated: They see it as permanent: they see it as permanent. The same method applies to the rest of the text. They did not escape from suffering: they did not escape from the entire suffering of the round. They will see: they will see.🔽The drinking vessel: this is the name of the surāmaṇḍa vessel.

original: Āpānīyakaṃsoti sarakassa nāmaṃ. Yasmā panettha āpaṃ pivanti, tasmā “āpānīyo”ti vuccati.
analyzed: āpānīyakaṃsoti sarakassa nāmam yasmai pana ittha āpam pivanti tasmai āpānīyaḥ ti vuccati
translated: But because they drink water in it, it is called “drinking vessel.”🔽It is a drinking vessel and a vessel, thus it is a drinking vessel. This is the name of the surāmaṇḍa vessel.

original: Āpānīyo ca so kaṃso cāti āpānīyakaṃso. Surāmaṇḍasarakassetaṃ nāmaṃ. “Vaṇṇasampanno”tiādivacanato
analyzed: āpānīyaḥ ca so kaṃso ca ati āpānīyakaṃso surāmaṇḍasarakassa etam nāmam vaṇṇa sampannaḥ ti ādi vacanato
translated: But because of the words “possessed of color” ,🔽it is said that the liquor in the vessel is so described.

original: pana kaṃse ṭhitapānameva evaṃ vuttaṃ. Ghammābhitattoti ghammena abhitatto. Ghammaparetoti
analyzed: pana kaṃse ṭhita pānam eva evam vuttam ghamma abhitatto ti ghammena abhitatto ghamma pareto ti
translated: It is struck by the hammer: it is struck by the hammer. It is overwhelmed by the hammer: it is overwhelmed by the hammer.

original: ghammena phuṭṭho, anugatoti attho. Pivato hi kho taṃ chādessatīti pivantassa taṃ
analyzed: ghammena phuṭṭhaḥ anugataḥ ti attho pivataḥ hi kho tam chādessati iti pivantassa tam
translated: “Covered by the sun” means “followed by the sun.” For it is said: “He will shade the drinker.

original: pānīyaṃ vaṇṇādisampattiyā ruccissati, sakalasarīraṃ vā pharitvā tuṭṭhiṃ uppādayamānaṃ
analyzed: pānīyam vaṇṇa ādi sampattiyā ruccissati sakala sarīram vā pharitvā tuṭṭhim uppādayamānam
translated: “He would be affected by the heat” means that he would be overcome by it. “It would be refreshing to him” means that it would be agreeable to him because of the excellence of its colour, etc., or it would stand refreshing his whole body by producing satisfaction.

original: ṭhassati. Appaṭisaṅkhāti apaccavekkhitvā.🔽Evameva khoti ettha idaṃ opammasaṃsandanaṃ – āpānīyakaṃso viya hi loke piyarūpaṃ
analyzed: ṭhassati a paṭisaṅkhāti a paccavekkhitvā  evam eva kho ti ettha idam opamma saṃsandanam āpānīya kaṃsaḥ viya hi loke piya rūpam
translated: “Without careful consideration”: without reflecting.

original: sātarūpaṃ ārammaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, ghammābhitattapuriso viya vaṭṭanissito puthujjano,🔽āpānīyakaṃsena nimantanapuriso viya loke piyarūpena sātarūpena ārammaṇena nimantakajano,🔽āpānīyakaṃse sampattiñca ādīnavañca ārocento āpānakamanusso viya ācariyupajjhāyādiko
analyzed: sātarūpam ārammaṇam daṭṭhabbam ghamma abhitatta purisaḥ viya vaṭṭa nissitaḥ puthujjano  āpānīya kaṃsena nimantana purisaḥ viya loke piya rūpena sāta rūpena ārammaṇena nimantaka jano  āpānīya kaṃse sampattiñca ādīnavañca ārocentaḥ āpānaka manussaḥ viya ācariya upajjhāya ādiko
translated: “So too, bhikkhus”: here is the correspondence. The object that is a basis for lust should be regarded as the bronze cup full of water; the worldling who is bound by the bondage of craving should be regarded as the man exhausted by heat;🔽the person who invites with an object that is a basis for lust should be regarded as the man who invites with the bronze cup full of water;🔽the good friend who points out the excellence and the danger should be regarded as the man who points out the excellence and the danger of the bronze cup full of water.

original: kalyāṇamitto. Yatheva hi tassa purisassa apalokitamanusso āpānīyakaṃse guṇañca ādīnavañca
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittaḥ yathā iva hi tassa purisassa apalokita manussaḥ āpānīya kaṃse guṇañca ādīnavañca
translated: For just as the man who points out the excellence and the danger of the bronze cup full of water to the man exhausted by heat

original: āroceti, evameva ācariyo vā upajjhāyo vā bhikkhuno pañcasu kāmaguṇesu assādañca nissaraṇañca katheti.
analyzed: āroceti evam eva ācariyaḥ vā upajjhāyaḥ vā bhikkhuno pañcasu kāmaguṇesu assādañca nissaraṇañca katheti
translated: so too, the teacher or the preceptor tells the bhikkhu of the gratification and the escape in the five cords of sensual pleasure.

original: Tattha yathā āpānīyakaṃsamhi guṇe ca ādīnave ca ārocite so puriso piyavaṇṇādisampadāyameva
analyzed: tattha yathā āpānīya kaṃsamhi guṇe ca ādīnave ca ārocite saḥ purisaḥ piya vaṇṇa ādi sampadā ayam eva
translated: Herein, just as when the man is told of the virtues and the danger in the bronze cup, he is only eager for the beauty, etc.,

original: sañjātavego “sace maraṇaṃ bhavissati, pacchā jānissāmī”ti sahasā appaṭisaṅkhāya taṃ🔽pivitvā maraṇaṃ vā maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ nigacchati, evameva, bhikkhu, “pañcasu🔽kāmaguṇesu dassanādivasena uppannasomanassamattameva assādo, ādīnavo pana diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyiko
analyzed: sañjāta vego sace maraṇam bhavissati pacchā jānissāmi iti sahasā a paṭisaṅkhāya tam  pivitvā maraṇam vā maraṇa mattam vā dukkham nigacchati evam eva bhikkhu pañcasu  kāma guṇesu dassana ādi vasena uppanna somanassa mattam eva assādaḥ ādīnavaḥ pana diṭṭhadhammika samparāyiko
translated: and without reflecting, he drinks it off all in a hurry, thinking “If it is poison, I shall die; if it is not, I shall not,” and so he comes to death or deadly suffering,🔽so too, the bhikkhu thinks, “The gratification in the five cords of sensual pleasure is only the mere joy and gladness that arise when one sees or hears the beauty, etc.,

original: bahu nānappakāro, appassādā kāmā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā”ti evaṃ ācariyupajjhāyehi
analyzed: bahu nānappakāraḥ appassādā kāmā bahu dukkhā bahu pāyāsā ati evam ācariya upajjhāyehi
translated: but the danger is the manifold suffering and affliction in this very life and in the life to come,” and so he reflects: “Sensual pleasures have little gratification and much suffering and affliction, while the peaceful state has much gratification and little suffering and affliction.”

original: ānisaṃsañca ādīnavañca kathetvā – “samaṇapaṭipadaṃ paṭipajja, indriyesu guttadvāro
analyzed: ānisaṃsam ca ādīnavam ca kathetvā samaṇa paṭipadam paṭipajje indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ
translated: When the teacher or the preceptor has told him of the advantages and the dangers in this way,🔽the bhikkhu should practice the way in the Dispensation, guarding the doors of his sense faculties,

original: bhava bhojane mattaññū jāgariyaṃ anuyutto”ti evaṃ ovaditopi assādabaddhacittatāya
analyzed: bhava bhojane mattaññū jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ ti evam ovaditaḥ api assāda baddha citta tāya
translated: and in moderation in eating, and devoted to wakefulness.”🔽But because of his attachment to sensual pleasures, he does not accept their advice.

original: “sace vuttappakāro ādīnavo bhavissati, pacchā jānissāmī”ti ācariyupajjhāye apasādetvā🔽uddesaparipucchādīni ceva vattapaṭipattiñca pahāya lokāmisakathaṃ kathento kāme paribhuñjitukāmatāya
analyzed: sace vutta ppakāraḥ ādīnavaḥ bhavissati pacchā jānissāmi iti ācariya upajjhāye apasādetvā  uddesa paripuccha ādīni ca iva vatta paṭipattim ca pahāya loka āmisa katham kathentaḥ kāme paribhuñjitu kāma tāya
translated: “If there is any danger of the sort they say, I will know about it later.”🔽He abandons the duties of the community life, such as the recitation of the code of rules and the formal meetings of the community, and he engages in worldly talk.

original: sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāyāvattati. Tato duccaritāni pūrento sandhicchedanādikāle🔽“coro aya”nti gahetvā rañño dassito idheva hatthapādādichedanaṃ patvā samparāye catūsu🔽apāyesu mahādukkhaṃ anubhoti.
analyzed: sikkham paccakkhāya hīnāya avattati tatas duccaritāni pūrentaḥ sandhi chedana ādi kāle  coraḥ ayanti gahetvā raññaḥ dassitaḥ idha iva hattha pāda ādi chedanam patvā samparāye catūsu  apāyesu mahā dukkham anubhoti
translated: Desiring to enjoy sensual pleasures, he gives up the training and returns to the lower life.🔽Then, as he indulges in misconduct, he is caught in the act of breaking into a house and is brought before the king to be punished.

original: Pānīyena vā vinetunti sītena vārinā harituṃ. Dadhimaṇḍakenāti dadhimaṇḍanamattena.🔽Bhaṭṭhaloṇikāyāti saloṇena sattupānīyena. Loṇasovīrakenāti sabbadhaññaphalakaḷīrādīni🔽pakkhipitvā loṇasovīrakaṃ nāma karonti, tena.
analyzed: pānīyena vā vinetum ti sītena vārinā haritum dadhimaṇḍakena ati dadhimaṇḍana mattena 🔽bhaṭṭhaloṇikāya ati sa loṇena sattu pānīyena loṇa sovīrakena ati sabba dhañña phala kaḷīra ādīni 🔽pakkhipitvā loṇasovīrakam nāma karonti tena
translated: He is executed right there, and in the next world he experiences great suffering in the four realms of misery.

original: Opammasaṃsandanaṃ panettha – ghammābhitattapuriso viya vaṭṭasannissitakāle yogāvacaro🔽daṭṭhabbo, tassa purisassa paṭisaṅkhā āpānīyakaṃsaṃ pahāya pānīyādīhi pipāsassa vinodanaṃ
analyzed: opamma saṃsandanam pana ittha ghamma abhitatta purisaḥ viya vaṭṭa sannissita kāle yogāvacaro  daṭṭhabbaḥ tassa purisassa paṭisaṅkhā āpānīya kaṃsam pahāya pānīya ādīhi pipāsassa vinodanam
translated: The simile here is this: the meditator in the time of the round of rebirths is like the man exhausted by heat.

original: viya bhikkhuno ācariyupajjhāyānaṃ ovāde ṭhatvā chadvārādīni pariggahetvā anukkamena🔽vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhentassa arahattaphalādhigamo, pānīyādīni cattāri pānāni viya hi cattāro🔽maggā, tesu aññataraṃ pivitvā surāpipāsitaṃ vinodetvā sukhino yena kāmaṃ gamanaṃ
analyzed: viya bhikkhuno ācariya upajjhāyānam ovāde ṭhatvā cha dvāra ādīni pariggahetvā anukkamena  vipassanam vaḍḍhentassa arahatta phala adhigamo pānīya ādīni cattāri pānāni viya hi cattāro  maggā tesu aññataram pivitvā surā pipāsitam vinodetvā sukhinaḥ yena kāmam gamanam
translated: The man’s reflection on the water and his abandoning of the idea of drinking it and his quenching of his thirst with drinking the water and so on is like the bhikkhu’s keeping to the advice of his teacher and preceptor and his guarding the six bases of his contact and so on and his gradually increasing his insight

original: viya khīṇāsavassa catumaggapānaṃ pivitvā taṇhaṃ vinodetvā agatapubbaṃ nibbānadisaṃ🔽gamanakālo veditabbo. Chaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: viya khīṇāsavassa catu magga pānam pivitvā taṇham vinodetvā a gata pubbam nibbāna disam  gamana kālo veditabbaḥ chaṭṭham
translated: and his reaching the fruition of arahantship. For the four paths are like the four kinds of drink, water and so on. And the time when the one free from cankers, after drinking the drink of one of the four paths, has quenched craving and gone to the end of the uncharted ocean of births, is like the time when the man, after drinking and quenching his thirst, goes where he wants. The sixth.

original: 7. Naḷakalāpīsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: naḷakalāpī sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The reed-bed sutta

original: 67. Sattame kinnu kho, āvusoti kasmā pucchati? “Evaṃ puṭṭho kathaṃ nu kho byākareyyā”ti.
analyzed: sattame kim nu kho āvuso iti kasmai pucchati evam puṭṭhaḥ katham nu kho byākareyya ati
translated: . Why does he ask, “What, friends, is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of forms? ” ? “How should I answer? ”

original: Therassa ajjhāsayajānanatthaṃ. Apica atīte dve aggasāvakā imaṃ pañhaṃ vinicchayiṃsūti
analyzed: therassa ajjhāsaya jānana attham apica atīte dve aggasāvakā imam pañham vinicchayiṃsu iti
translated: In order to know the Elder’s intention. Besides, he asks: “In the past, two chief disciples settled this question,”

original: anāgate bhikkhū jānissantītipi pucchati. Idāneva kho mayanti idaṃ thero yassa nāmarūpassa🔽viññāṇaṃ paccayoti vuttaṃ, tadeva nāmarūpaṃ viññāṇassa paccayoti vuttattā āha. Naḷakalāpiyoti
analyzed: anāgate bhikkhū jānissanti iti pi pucchati idānā iva kho idam theraḥ yassa nāma rūpassa  viññāṇam paccayaḥ ti vuttam tat eva nāma rūpam viññāṇassa paccayaḥ ti vuttattā āha naḷa kalāpiyā ti
translated: “In the future, bhikkhus will know,” and “Just now, I myself have heard this from the Blessed One.”🔽The Elder said, “Just now, I myself have heard this from the Blessed One” because he said, “Consciousness is conditioned by name-and-form,” and “Name-and-form is conditioned by consciousness.”

original: idha pana ayakalāpādivasena upamaṃ anāharitvā viññāṇanāmarūpānaṃ abaladubbalabhāvadassanatthaṃ ayaṃ upamā ābhatā.
analyzed: idha pana aya kalāpa ādi vasena upamam an āharitvā viññāṇa nāma rūpānam abala dubbala bhāva dassana attham ayam upamā ābhatā
translated: The simile of the reed and the lump of clay is given in order to show the weakness and feebleness of consciousness and name-and-form.

original: Nirodho hotīti ettake ṭhāne paccayuppannapañcavokārabhavavasena desanā kathitā. Chattiṃsāya
analyzed: nirodhaḥ hoti iti ettake ṭhāne paccaya uppanna pañcavokāra bhava vasena desanā kathitā chattiṃsāya
translated: The teaching is given in terms of the five aggregates that are subject to clinging and the aggregates that arise in the future.

original: vatthūhīti heṭṭhā vissajjitesu dvādasasu padesu ekekasmiṃ tiṇṇaṃ tiṇṇaṃ vasena chattiṃsāya
analyzed: vatthūhi iti heṭṭhā vissajjitesu dvādasasu padesu ekekasmin tiṇṇam tiṇṇam vasena chattiṃsāya
translated: The thirty-six positions are the twelve positions mentioned above, each of which is threefold.

original: kāraṇehi. Ettha ca paṭhamo dhammakathikaguṇo, dutiyā paṭipatti, tatiyaṃ paṭipattiphalaṃ.
analyzed: kāraṇehi ettha ca paṭhamaḥ dhamma kathika guṇaḥ dutiyā paṭipatti tatiyam paṭipatti phalam
translated: The first is the quality of a preacher of the Dhamma; the second, practice; the third, the fruit of practice.

original: Tattha paṭhamanayena desanāsampatti kathitā, dutiyena sekkhabhūmi, tatiyena asekkhabhūmīti. Sattamaṃ.
analyzed: tattha paṭhama nayena desanā sampatti kathitā dutiyena sekkha bhūmi tatiyena asekkha bhūmi iti sattamam
translated: Herein, the first method is the fulfilment of teaching, the second the plane of the trainer, and the third the plane of the non-trainer. Seventh.

original: 8. Kosambisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kosambi sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The Kosambi Sutta Commentary

original: 68. Aṭṭhame aññatrevāti ekacco hi parassa saddahitvā yaṃ esa bhaṇati, taṃ bhūtanti
analyzed: aṭṭhame aññatra iva ati ekaccaḥ hi parassa saddahitvā yam esa bhaṇati tam bhūta nti
translated: . In the eighth sutta, “apart from what is seen” : for one person believes another, and he takes it that what the other says is true.

original: gaṇhāti. Aparassa nisīditvā cintentassa yaṃ kāraṇaṃ ruccati, so “atthi eta”nti ruciyā
analyzed: gaṇhāti aparassa nisīditvā cintentassa yam kāraṇam ruccati saḥ atthi etat ti ruciyā
translated: Another sits listening and he takes it that there is such a thing because the reason he fancies is a good one.

original: gaṇhāti. Eko “cirakālato paṭṭhāya evaṃ anussavo atthi, bhūtameta”nti anussavena gaṇhāti.
analyzed: gaṇhāti ekaḥ cira kālataḥ paṭṭhāya evam anussavaḥ atthi bhūtam etat ti anussavena gaṇhāti
translated: Another takes it that there is such a thing because there is a tradition that has come down from ancient times.

original: Aññassa vitakkayato ekaṃ kāraṇaṃ upaṭṭhāti, so “attheta”nti ākāraparivitakkena gaṇhāti.
analyzed: aññassa vitakkayataḥ ekam kāraṇam upaṭṭhāti saḥ attha itanti ākāra parivitakkena gaṇhāti
translated: Another thinks of a reason, and he takes it that there is such a thing because the reason occurs to him.

original: Aparassa cintayato ekā diṭṭhi uppajjati, yāyassa taṃ kāraṇaṃ nijjhāyantassa khamati,
analyzed: aparassa cintayataḥ ekā diṭṭhi uppajjati yā yassa tam kāraṇam nijjhāyantassa khamati
translated: Another thinks it over and a view arises in him that he is satisfied with after pondering it,

original: so “attheta”nti diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā gaṇhāti. Thero pana pañcapi etāni kāraṇāni
analyzed: so diṭṭhi nijjhāna khantiyā gaṇhāti thero pana pañca api etāni kāraṇāni
translated: and he takes it that there is such a thing because of his satisfaction with the view after pondering it. But the Elder took it that there was such a thing

original: paṭikkhipitvā paccakkhañāṇena paṭividdhabhāvaṃ pucchanto aññatreva, āvuso musila,
analyzed: paṭikkhipitvā paccakkha ñāṇena paṭividdha bhāvam pucchantaḥ aññatra iva āvuso musila
translated: Having rejected the question, he asked about the state of penetration by knowledge of opposition, saying, “Apart from faith, friend Musīla … ”

original: saddhāyātiādimāha. Tattha aññatrevāti saddhādīni kāraṇāni ṭhapetvā, vinā etehi kāraṇehīti
analyzed: saddhāya ati ādim āha tattha aññatra iva ati saddhā ādīni kāraṇāni ṭhapetvā vinā etehi kāraṇehi iti
translated: Herein, apart from faith means leaving aside faith and the rest, without these reasons.

original: attho. Bhavanirodho nibbānanti pañcakkhandhanirodho nibbānaṃ.
analyzed: atthaḥ bhava nirodhaḥ nibbānanti pañca kkhandha nirodhaḥ nibbānam
translated: The cessation of being is Nibbāna means the cessation of the five aggregates is Nibbāna.

original: Tuṇhī ahosīti thero khīṇāsavo, ahaṃ pana khīṇāsavoti vā na vāti vā avatvā tuṇhīyeva
analyzed: tuṇhī thero khīṇa āsavaḥ aham pana khīṇa āsavaḥ iti vā na vā ati vā avatvā
translated: He was silent means that the elder did not say either “I am one whose cankers are destroyed” or “I am not one whose cankers are destroyed.”

original: ahosi. Āyasmā nārado āyasmantaṃ paviṭṭhaṃ etadavocāti kasmā avoca? So kira cintesi🔽– “bhavanirodho nibbānaṃ nāmāti sekhehipi jānitabbo pañho esa, ayaṃ pana thero imaṃ
analyzed: āyasmā nāradaḥ āyasmantam paviṭṭham etat avoca ati kasmai avoca saḥ kira cintesi  bhava nirodhaḥ nibbānam nāma ati sekhehi pi jānitabbo pañhaḥ esa ayam pana thero imaṃ
translated: Why did the venerable Nārada say to the venerable Paviṭṭha, “Friend Paviṭṭha … ”? It seems that he thought:

original: theraṃ asekhabhūmiyā kāreti, imaṃ ṭhānaṃ jānāpessāmī”ti etaṃ avoca.
analyzed: theram asekha bhūmiyā kāreti imam ṭhānam jānāpessāmi iti etam avoca
translated: “The question ‘What is called the cessation of being is Nibbāna?’ is one that should be known by those still in training. But this elder is making this elder a non-returner. I shall make him know this state.”

original: Sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhanti saha vipassanāya maggapaññāya suṭṭhu diṭṭhaṃ. Na camhi
analyzed: sammappaññāya su diṭṭhanti saha vipassanāya magga paññāya suṭṭhu diṭṭham na ca mhi
translated: Well seen with right understanding means well seen with the understanding of the path together with insight.

original: arahanti anāgāmimagge ṭhitattā arahaṃ na homīti dīpeti. Yaṃ panassa idāni “bhavanirodho
analyzed: arahanti anāgāmi magge ṭhita ttā araham na homi iti dīpeti yam pana assa idāni bhava nirodho
translated: “I am not an Arahant” because he is established in the path of non-returner.

original: nibbāna”nti ñāṇaṃ, taṃ ekūnavīsatiyā paccavekkhaṇañāṇehi vimuttaṃ paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ.
analyzed: nibbānanti ñāṇam tat ekūnavīsatiyā paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇehi vimuttam paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam
translated: The knowledge that he now has, “The cessation of being is Nibbāna,” is the knowledge of reviewing, which is liberated by the nineteen reviewing knowledges.

original: Udapānoti vīsatiṃsahatthagambhīro pānīyakūpo. Udakavārakoti udakaussiñcanavārako.🔽Udakanti hi kho ñāṇaṃ assāti tīre ṭhitassa olokayato evaṃ ñāṇaṃ bhaveyya. Na ca kāyena
analyzed: udapāno ti vīsatiṃsa hattha gambhīro pānīyakūpaḥ udaka vārako iti udaka aussiñcana vārako  udakam ti hi kho ñāṇam assa ati tīre ṭhitassa olokayataḥ evam ñāṇam bhaveyya na ca kāyena
translated: Udapāna means a water-well twenty-five fathoms deep. Udakavārako means a water-dipper.🔽For the knowledge that there is water would arise only in one standing on the bank looking at it. But he could not live by taking the water with his body

original: phusitvāti udakaṃ pana nīharitvā kāyena phusitvā viharituṃ na sakkuṇeyya. Udapāne
analyzed: phusitvā iti udakam pana nīharitvā kāyena phusitvā viharitum na sakkuṇeyya udapāne
translated: and touching it.

original: udakadassanaṃ viya hi anāgāmino nibbānadassanaṃ, ghammābhitattapuriso viya anāgāmī,
analyzed: udaka dassanam viya hi anāgāminaḥ nibbāna dassanam ghamma abhitatta purisaḥ viya anāgāmī
translated: For the reviewing knowledge of the non-returner is like the seeing of the water in the well; the non-returner is like the man oppressed by heat;

original: udakavārako viya arahattamaggo, yathā ghammābhitattapuriso udapāne udakaṃ passati.
analyzed: udaka vārakaḥ viya arahatta maggaḥ yathā ghamma abhitatta purisaḥ udapāne udakam passati
translated: the path of arahatship is like the water-dipper; just as the man oppressed by heat sees the water in the well,

original: Evaṃ anāgāmī paccavekkhaṇañāṇena “upari arahattaphalasamayo nāma atthī”ti jānāti.
analyzed: evam anāgāmī paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇena upari arahatta phala samayaḥ nāma atthi iti jānāti
translated: so the non-returner knows by reviewing knowledge that there is a time for the realization of the fruit of arahatship.

original: Yathā pana so puriso udakavārakassa natthitāya udakaṃ nīharitvā kāyena phusituṃ na🔽labhati, evaṃ anāgāmī arahattamaggassa natthitāya nibbānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā arahattaphalasamāpattiṃ
analyzed: yathā pana saḥ purisaḥ udakavārakassa natthitāya udakam nīharitvā kāyena phusitum na  labhati evam anāgāmī arahatta maggassa na atthitāya nibbānam ārammaṇam katvā arahatta phala samāpattim
translated: But just as the man, because there is no water in the channel, cannot touch the water with his body by taking hold of the channel, so too, because there is no path of arahatship, the non-returner cannot touch the attainment of the fruition of arahatship by making Nibbāna his object.

original: appetvā nisīdituṃ na labhati. Aṭṭhamaṃ.
analyzed: appetvā nisīditum na labhati aṭṭhamam
translated: Just as that man, because there is no water-gap, cannot get out water by touching it with his body, so too the non-returner, because there is no path of arahatship, cannot sit down by entering upon the attainment of the fruition of arahatship with Nibbāna as object.

original: 9. Upayantisuttavaṇṇanā🔽69. Navame upayantoti udakavaḍḍhanasamaye upari gacchanto. Mahānadiyoti gaṅgāyamunādikā🔽mahāsaritāyo. Upayāpetīti upari yāpeti, vaḍḍheti pūretīti attho. Avijjā upayantīti🔽avijjā upari gacchantī saṅkhārānaṃ paccayo bhavituṃ sakkuṇantī. Saṅkhāre upayāpetīti🔽saṅkhāre upari yāpeti vaḍḍheti. Evaṃ sabbapadesu attho veditabbo. Apayantoti apagacchanto
analyzed: upayanti sutta vaṇṇanā  navame upayantaḥ iti udaka vaḍḍhana samaye upari gacchantaḥ gaṅgā yamunā ādikā  upayāpeti iti upari yāpeti vaḍḍheti pūreti iti atthaḥ avijjāḥ upayanti iti  avijjā upari gacchantī saṅkhārānam paccayaḥ bhavitum sakkuṇantī saṅkhāre upayāpeti iti  saṅkhāre upari yāpeti vaḍḍheti evam sabba padesu atthaḥ veditabbaḥ apayantaḥ ti apagacchantaḥ
translated: The ninth sutta

original: osaranto. Avijjā apayantīti avijjā apagacchamānā osaramānā upari saṅkhārānaṃ paccayo
analyzed: osarantaḥ avijjāḥ apayanti iti avijjāḥ apagacchamānāḥ osaramānāḥ upari saṅkhārānam paccayaḥ
translated: In the ninth sutta, “going up” means going up at the time of the rise of the water. “Great rivers” means the great rivers such as the Ganges and the Yamunā. “He causes to go up” means he causes to go up, to rise, to fill up. “Ignorance goes up” means ignorance, going up, being able to be a condition for formations. “He causes formations to go up” means he causes formations to go up, to rise. The meaning should be understood in this way in all the passages. “Going down” means going down, descending. “Ignorance goes down” means ignorance, going down, descending, being a condition for formations.

original: bhavituṃ na sakkuṇantīti attho. Saṅkhāre apayāpetīti saṅkhāre apagacchāpeti. Esa
analyzed: bhavitum na sakkuṇanti iti attho saṅkhāre apayāpeti iti saṅkhāre apagacchāpeti esa
translated: The meaning is that they are unable to exist. He makes them go away: he makes them depart.

original: nayo sabbapadesu. Navamaṃ.
analyzed: nayaḥ sabba padesu navamam
translated: This method applies in all instances. The ninth.

original: 10. Susimasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: susima sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Susima Sutta is finished.

original: 70. Dasame garukatoti sabbehi devamanussehi pāsāṇacchattaṃ viya cittena garukato.
analyzed: dasame garukato ti sabbehi deva manussehi pāsāṇa chattam viya cittena garukato
translated: In the tenth, he is revered: he is revered by all gods and men with the mind, as if with a parasol of stone.🔽He is honored: he is dear by means of the mind. He is respected: he is respected by the offering of the four requisites. He is worshipped: he is worshipped by the act of paying homage.

original: Mānitoti manena piyāyito. Pūjitoti catupaccayapūjāya pūjito. Apacitoti nīcavuttikaraṇena🔽apacito. Satthārañhi disvā manussā hatthikkhandhādīhi otaranti maggaṃ denti, aṃsakūṭato
analyzed: mānitaḥ uti manena piyāyito pūjito iti catu paccaya pūjāya pūjitaḥ apacito ti nīca vutti karaṇena  apacitaḥ satthāram hi disvā manussāḥ hatthi kkhandha ādīhi otaranti maggam denti aṃsa kūṭato
translated: He is saluted:

original: sāṭakaṃ apanenti, āsanato vuṭṭhahanti vandanti. Evaṃ so tehi apacito nāma hoti. Susimoti🔽evaṃnāmako vedaṅgesu kusalo paṇḍitaparibbājako. Ehi tvanti tesaṃ kira etadahosi –
analyzed: sāṭakam apanenti āsanataḥ vuṭṭhahanti vandanti evam saḥ tehi apacitaḥ nāma hoti susimaḥ iti  evaṃnāmakaḥ vedaṅgesu kusalaḥ paṇḍita paribbājako ehi tvam ti tesam kira etat ahosi
translated: when they see the Teacher, men get down from the backs of elephants, etc., give way in the road, remove their cloaks from their shoulders, get down from their couches, pay homage, and so on. Thus he is called “saluted” by them. Susima: a wise wanderer skilled in the Vedas, who had this name. Come: it seems that they thought thus:

original: “samaṇo gotamo na jātigottādīni āgamma lābhaggappatto jāto, kaviseṭṭho panesa uttamakavitāya
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ na jāti gotta ādīni āgamma lābha agga ppattaḥ jātaḥ kavi seṭṭhaḥ pana īsaḥ uttama kavi tāya
translated: “The recluse Gotama has not become the foremost in gain by birth, clan, etc., but rather by being the best of poets, the best of teachers, the best of expounders, the best of those with knowledge and vision, the best of those with eloquence, the best of those with the threefold knowledge, the best of those with the six kinds of direct knowledge, the best of those with the four kinds of analytical knowledge, the best of those with the four discriminations, the best of those with the five eyes, the best of those with the eight deliverances, the best of those with the ten totalities, the best of those with the four foundations of mindfulness, the best of those with the four right efforts, the best of those with the four bases of psychic power, the best of those with the five spiritual faculties, the best of those with the five powers, the best of those with the seven factors of enlightenment, the best of those with the Noble Eightfold Path, the best of those with the four paths, the best of those with the four fruits, the best of those with the four analytical knowledges, the best of those with the six direct knowledges, the best of those with the ten powers, the best of those with the four kinds of intrepidity, the best of those with the four kinds of exact knowledge, the best of those with the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, the best of those with the thirty-seven states partaking of enlightenment, the best of those

original: sāvakānaṃ ganthaṃ bandhitvā deti, taṃ te uggaṇhitvā upaṭṭhākānaṃ upanisinnakathampi
analyzed: sāvakānam gantham bandhitvā deti tam te uggaṇhitvā upaṭṭhākānam upanisinna katham pi
translated: and he gives them to his disciples to commit to writing. They learn it and then tell it to their attendants,

original: anumodanampi sarabhaññampīti evamādīni kathenti, te tesaṃ pasannā lābhaṃ upasaṃharanti.
analyzed: anumodanam pi sarabhaññam pi iti evamādīni kathenti te tesam pasannāḥ lābham upasaṃharanti
translated: who are sitting near, and they rejoice in it and express their appreciation. And the attendants give them gifts.

original: Sace mayaṃ yaṃ samaṇo gotamo jānāti, tato thokaṃ jāneyyāma, attano samayaṃ tattha
analyzed: sace mayam yam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jānāti tatas thokam jāneyyāma attanaḥ samayam tattha
translated: If we could just know a little bit more than the recluse Gotama knows, we could put our own doctrines into his mouth

original: pakkhipitvā mayampi upaṭṭhākānaṃ katheyyāma, tato etehi lābhitarā bhaveyyāma. Ko
analyzed: pakkhipitvā mayam pi upaṭṭhākānam katheyyāma tatas etehi lābhitarāḥ bhaveyyāma ko
translated: and then tell them to our attendants. We would get more gifts than they do.

original: nu kho samaṇassa gotamassa santike pabbajitvā khippameva uggaṇhituṃ sakkhissatī”ti.
analyzed: nu kho samaṇassa gotamassa santike pabbajitvā khippam eva uggaṇhitum sakkhissati iti
translated: Who, now, could go forth under the recluse Gotama and quickly learn this Dhamma?”

original: Te evaṃ cintetvā “susimo paṭibalo”ti disvā taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evamāhaṃsu.🔽Yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkamīti kasmā upasaṅkami? Evaṃ kirassa ahosi, “kassa nu
analyzed: te evam cintetvā susimaḥ paṭibalaḥ ti disvā tam upasaṅkamitvā evam āhaṃsu  yena ayasmai ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami iti kasmai upasaṅkami evam kirassa ahosi kassa nu
translated: After thinking thus, they saw that Susı̄ma was capable of doing it, so they approached him and said to him:🔽“Come, friend Susı̄ma, go forth under the recluse Gotama.

original: kho santikaṃ gantvā ahaṃ imaṃ dhammaṃ khippaṃ laddhuṃ sakkhissāmī”ti? Tato cintesi
analyzed: kho santikam gantvā aham imam dhammam khippam laddhum sakkhissāmi iti tatas cintesi
translated: Why did he approach the venerable Ananda? It seems that he thought: “Now, who can I go to to quickly get this Dhamma?” Then he thought:

original: – “samaṇo gotamo garu tejussado niyamamanuyutto, na sakkā akāle upasaṅkamituṃ, aññepi
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ garu tejussadaḥ niyamam anuyuttaḥ na sakkā akāle upasaṅkamitum aññe pi
translated: “The recluse Gotama is powerful and majestic. He is strict in his observances. It is not possible to approach him at an improper time.

original: bahū khattiyādayo samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamanti, tasmimpi samaye na sakkā upasaṅkamituṃ.🔽Sāvakesupissa sāriputto mahāpañño vipassanālakkhaṇamhi etadagge ṭhapito, mahāmoggallāno
analyzed: bahū khattiya ādayaḥ samaṇam gotamam upasaṅkamanti tasmin pi samaye na sakkāḥ upasaṅkamitum  sāvakesu pissa sāriputtaḥ mahā paññaḥ vipassanā lakkhaṇamhi etad agge ṭhapitaḥ mahā moggallānaḥ
translated: Besides, many nobles and others approach him. It is not possible to approach him at that time.🔽And his disciples are also great. Sāriputta, who has great wisdom, is placed at the head of those who possess insight.

original: samādhilakkhaṇasmiṃ etadagge ṭhapito, mahākassapo dhutaṅgadharesu anuruddho dibbacakkhukesu,🔽puṇṇo mantāṇiputto dhammakathikesu, upālitthero vinayadharesu etadagge ṭhapito, ayaṃ
analyzed: samādhi lakkhaṇasmiṃ etad agge ṭhapitaḥ mahākassapaḥ dhutaṅga dharesu anuruddhaḥ dibbacakkhukesu  puṇṇaḥ mantāṇi putto dhamma kathikesu upāli ttheraḥ vinaya dharesu etad agge ṭhapitaḥ ayaṃ
translated: Mahāmoggallāna, who has great concentration, is placed at the head of those who possess concentration. Mahākassapa, who is an ascetic, is placed at the head of those who are ascetics. Anuruddha, who has the divine eye, is placed at the head of those who possess the divine eye.🔽Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta, who is a preacher of the Dhamma, is placed at the head of those who preach the Dhamma. The elder Upāli, who is a master of the Vinaya, is placed at the head of those who are masters of the Vinaya.

original: pana ānando bahussuto tipiṭakadharo, satthāpissa tattha tattha kathitaṃ dhammaṃ āharitvā
analyzed: pana ānandaḥ bahussutaḥ tipiṭaka dharaḥ satthā apissa tattha tattha kathitaṃ dhammaṃ āharitvā
translated: This Ānanda, who is learned and a master of the scriptures, is placed at the head of those who are learned and masters of the scriptures.

original: katheti, pañcasu ṭhānesu etadagge ṭhapito, aṭṭhannaṃ varānaṃ lābhī, catūhi acchariyabbhutadhammehi
analyzed: kathā iti pañcasu ṭhānesu etad agge ṭhapitaḥ aṭṭhannam lābhī catūhi
translated: The Teacher has placed him at the head of those who are of great service to him, who are grateful and thankful, and who are devoted to the duties of an attendant. He is the recipient of eight special privileges and possesses four extraordinary qualities.

original: samannāgato, tassa samīpaṃ gato khippaṃ dhammaṃ laddhuṃ sakkhissāmī”ti. Tasmā yenāyasmā
analyzed: samannāgataḥ tassa samīpam gataḥ khippam dhammam laddhum sakkhissāmi iti tasmai yena ayasmai
translated: I will be able to receive the Teaching quickly.” Therefore he went to the Venerable

original: ānando tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: “I shall be able to receive the Dhamma quickly if I go to him.” Therefore he approached the Venerable Ānanda.

original: Yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamīti kasmā sayaṃ apabbājetvā upasaṅkami? Evaṃ kirassa ahosi🔽– “ayaṃ titthiyasamaye pāṭiyekko ‘ahaṃ satthā’ti paṭijānanto carati, pabbajitvā sāsanassa
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami iti kasmai sayam a pabbājetvā upasaṅkami evam kirassa ahosi  ayam titthiya samaye pāṭiyekkaḥ aham satthā iti paṭijānanto carati pabbajitvā sāsanassa
translated: He approached the Blessed One. Why did he approach the Blessed One, having sent him away himself? It seems that he thought:

original: alābhāyapi parisakkeyya. Na kho panassāhaṃ ajjhāsayaṃ ājānāmi, satthā jānissatī”ti.
analyzed: alābhāya api parisakkeyya na kho pana assa aham ajjhāsayam ājānāmi satthā jānissati iti
translated: “This wanderer is going about claiming that he is a teacher on his own account. After going forth, he might cause a schism in the Dispensation. But I do not understand his intention; the Teacher will know.”

original: Tasmā taṃ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami. Tenahānanda, susimaṃ pabbājethāti satthā
analyzed: tasmā tam ādāya yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami tena ha ānanda susimam pabbājetha ati satthā
translated: Therefore he approached the Blessed One, taking him with him. The words “Therefore, Ānanda, let the going forth be given to Susīma” were spoken by the Teacher,

original: kira cintesi – “ayaṃ paribbājako titthiyasamaye ‘ahaṃ pāṭiyekko satthā’ti paṭijānamāno
analyzed: kira cintesi ayam paribbājakaḥ titthiya samaye aham pāṭiyekkaḥ satthā iti paṭijānamāno
translated: it seems, with the thought: “This wanderer is going about claiming that he is a teacher on his own account.

original: carati, ‘idha maggabrahmacariyaṃ carituṃ icchāmī’ti kira vadati. Kiṃ nu kho mayi
analyzed: carati magga brahmacariyam caritum icchāmi iti kira vadati kim nu kho mayi
translated: He says: ‘I wish to live the spiritual life here.’ What is his intention?

original: pasanno, udāhu mayhaṃ sāvakesu, udāhu mayhaṃ vā mama sāvakānaṃ vā dhammakathāya pasanno”ti?
analyzed: pasannaḥ udāhu mayham sāvakesu udāhu mayham vā mama sāvakānam vā dhamma kathāya pasannaḥ iti
translated: “Is he pleased with me, or with my disciples, or with the talk on Dhamma that he has heard from me or from my disciples?”

original: Athassa ekaṭṭhānepi pasādābhāvaṃ ñatvā, “ayaṃ mama sāsane dhammaṃ thenessāmīti pabbajati.🔽Itissa āgamanaṃ aparisuddhaṃ; nipphatti nu kho kīdisā”ti? Olokento “kiñcāpi ‘dhammaṃ
analyzed: athassa eka ṭṭhāne pi pasāda abhāvam ñatvā ayam mama sāsane dhammam thenessāmi iti pabbajati  iti ssa āgamanam aparisuddham nipphatti nu kho kīdisā ti olokento kiñca api dhammaṃ
translated: Then, knowing that he was not pleased with any of these, he thought, “He has gone forth thinking, ‘I will refute the Dhamma in my Teacher’s Dispensation.’🔽I shall look at his coming. Is it pure or not? What will his achievement be?”

original: thenessāmī’ti pabbajati, katipāheneva pana ghaṭetvā arahattaṃ gaṇhissatī”ti ñatvā
analyzed: thenessāmi iti pabbajati kati pāhena iva pana ghaṭetvā arahattam gaṇhissati iti ñatvā
translated: Looking, he saw that although he had gone forth thinking, “I will refute the Dhamma,” he would be able to attain arahatship within a few days.

original: “tenahānanda, susimaṃ pabbājethā”ti āha.
analyzed: tena ha ānanda susimam pabbājetha iti āha
translated: So he said, “Well then, Ānanda, let him go forth.”

original: Aññā byākatā hotīti te kira bhikkhū satthu santike kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā temāsaṃ vassaṃ
analyzed: aññā byākatā hoti iti te kira bhikkhū satthu santike kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā temāsam vassam
translated: “The declaration of final knowledge”: these bhikkhus, it seems, received a meditation subject from the Teacher and spent the three months of the Rains Retreat

original: vasantā tasmiṃyeva antotemāse ghaṭentā vāyamantā arahattaṃ paṭilabhiṃsu. Te “paṭiladdhaguṇaṃ
analyzed: vasantā tasmin yeva antotemāse arahattam paṭilabhiṃsu te paṭiladdha guṇam
translated: meditating. Within that time they attained arahatship by striving and making effort. They thought, “We will inform the Teacher of the quality we have attained.”

original: satthu ārocessāmā”ti pavāritapavāraṇā senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā satthu santikaṃ āgantvā
analyzed: satthu ārocessāma ati pavārita pavāraṇā senāsanam saṃsāmetvā satthu santikam āgantvā
translated: So when the invitation ceremony was over, they put their dwellings in order, took up their bowls and outer robes, and set out for the Teacher.

original: attano paṭiladdhaguṇaṃ ārocesuṃ. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Aññāti arahattassa nāmaṃ.
analyzed: attanaḥ paṭiladdha guṇam ārocesuṃ tam sandhāya itam vuttam aññā ti arahattassa nāmaṃ
translated: and they told him of the bhikkhu’s attainment. The text is stated with reference to that. ‘ Another’ : the name of arahatship.

original: Byākatāti ārocitā. Assosīti so kira ohitasoto hutvā tesaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ṭhitaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: byākatā ati ārocitā assosi iti so kira ohita sotaḥ hutvā tesam tesam bhikkhūnam ṭhita ṭṭhānam
translated: ‘ Announced’ : made known. ‘ Heard’ : it seems that he went to the place where each bhikkhu was standing,

original: gacchati taṃ taṃ kathaṃ suṇitukāmo. Yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamīti kasmā upasaṅkami?
analyzed: gacchati tam tam katham suṇitu kāmaḥ yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami iti kasmai upasaṅkami
translated: listening with rapt attention, eager to hear this and that story. ‘ He approached those bhikkhus’ : why did he approach them?

original: Taṃ kirassa pavattiṃ sutvā etadahosi – “aññā nāma imasmiṃ sāsane paramappamāṇaṃ sārabhūtā
analyzed: tam kirassa pavattim sutvā etat ahosi aññā nāma imasmim sāsane parama ppamāṇam sāra bhūtā
translated: It seems that when he heard of their conduct, he thought thus: ‘ Arahatship is the highest measure in this Dispensation, the essence of the Dhamma.

original: ācariyamuṭṭhi maññe bhavissati, pucchitvā naṃ jānissāmī”ti. Tasmā upasaṅkami.
analyzed: maññe bhavissati pucchitvā nam jānissāmi iti tasmai upasaṅkami
translated: It will be like a teacher’s trick. I shall ask him and find out.’ Therefore he approached them.

original: Anekavihitanti anekavidhaṃ. Iddhividhanti iddhikoṭṭhāsaṃ. Āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvanti
analyzed: aneka vihitanti anekavidham iddhi vidhanti iddhi koṭṭhāsam āvibhāvam tirobhāvanti
translated: ‘ Many kinds’ : of many kinds. ‘ Kinds of supernormal power’ : the source of supernormal power. ‘ Becoming invisible and becoming visible’ :

original: āvibhāvaṃ gahetvā tirobhāvaṃ, tirobhāvaṃ gahetvā āvibhāvaṃ kātuṃ sakkothāti pucchati.
analyzed: āvi bhāvam gahetvā tirobhāvam tirobhāvam gahetvā āvi bhāvam kātum sakkotha ati pucchati
translated: he asks whether they can make themselves invisible and then become visible, and make themselves visible and then become invisible.

original: Tirokuṭṭanti parakuṭṭaṃ. Itarapadadvayepi eseva nayo. Ummujjanimujjanti ummujjanañca
analyzed: tirokuṭṭanti parakuṭṭam itara pada dvaye pi eṣa iva nayaḥ ummujja nimujjanti ummujjanam ca
translated: ‘ Through walls, through ramparts, through mountains’ : through other people’s walls, through other people’s ramparts, through mountains. The method is the same in the other two terms. ‘ Rising up out of the earth’ :

original: nimujjanañca. Pallaṅkenāti pallaṅkabandhanena. Kamathāti nisīdituṃ vā gantuṃ vā sakkothāti🔽pucchati? Pakkhī sakuṇoti pakkhayutto sakuṇo. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthārato pana
analyzed: nimujjanam ca pallaṅkena ati pallaṅka bandhanena kamatha ati nisīditum vā gantum vā sakkotha ati  pucchati pakkhī sakuṇo ti pakkha yuttaḥ sakuṇaḥ ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthārato pana
translated: and sinking. By the couch: by the couch-tie. To go: can you sit down or go?🔽Bird: a bird that has wings. This is in brief. But in detail,🔽🔽

original: imassa iddhividhassa, ito paresaṃ dibbasotādīnañca vaṇṇanānayo visuddhimagge vuttanayena veditabboti.🔽Santā vimokkhāti aṅgasantatāya ceva ārammaṇasantatāya ca santā āruppavimokkhā. Kāyena🔽phusitvāti nāmakāyena phusitvā paṭilabhitvā. Paññāvimuttā kho mayaṃ, āvusoti, āvuso,
analyzed: imassa iddhividhassa itas paresam dibba sota ādīnam ca vaṇṇanā nayaḥ visuddhi magge vutta nayena veditabbaḥ ti  santā vimokkhā ati aṅga santatāya ca iva ārammaṇa santatāya ca santā āruppa vimokkhā kāyena  phusitvā ti nāmakāyena phusitvā paṭilabhitvā paññā vimuttā kho mayam āvuso ti āvuso
translated: and submerging. “By means of a seat” means by means of a seat-strap. “Can you” means: can you sit down or go? “A bird” means a bird that flies. This is the brief account. But the method of explaining the supernormal powers and the divine ear, etc., in detail should be understood according to the Visuddhimagga.🔽“The peaceful liberations” : the formless attainments are peaceful because of the peacefulness of the component factors and because of the peacefulness of the object.

original: mayaṃ nijjhānakā sukkhavipassakā paññāmatteneva vimuttāti dasseti. Ājāneyyāsi vā
analyzed: mayam nijjhānakā sukkha vipassakā paññā mattena iva vimuttā ati dasseti ājāneyyā asi vā
translated: “Having contacted with the body” means having contacted with the mental body and having attained. “We are liberated in mind” means we are liberated by means of wisdom, O friend.

original: tvaṃ, āvuso susima, na vā tvaṃ ājāneyyāsīti kasmā evamāhaṃsu? Evaṃ kira nesaṃ ahosi
analyzed: tvam āvuso susima na vā tvam ājāneyyā asi iti kasmai evam āhaṃsu evam kira
translated: “You may know this, friend Susīma, or you may not know this” : why did they say this? They thought thus:

original: – “mayaṃ imassa ajjhāsayaṃ gahetvā kathetuṃ na sakkhissāma, dasabalaṃ pana pucchitvā
analyzed: mayam imassa ajjhāsayam gahetvā kathetum na sakkhissāma dasabalam pana pucchitvā
translated: “We will not be able to speak after having understood his intention. But if we ask the One of Ten Powers,

original: nikkaṅkho bhavissatī”ti. Dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇanti vipassanāñāṇaṃ, taṃ paṭhamataraṃ uppajjati.
analyzed: nikkaṅkhaḥ bhavissati iti dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam ti vipassanā ñāṇam tat paṭhamataram uppajjati
translated: Knowledge of the stability of dhammas: this is insight knowledge, which arises first.🔽Knowledge of Nibbāna: this is path knowledge, which arises later.

original: Nibbāne ñāṇanti vipassanāya ciṇṇante pavattamaggañāṇaṃ, taṃ pacchā uppajjati. Tasmā bhagavā evamāha.
analyzed: nibbāne ñāṇanti vipassanāya pavatta magga ñāṇam tam pacchā uppajjati tasmai bhagavā evam āha
translated: That is why the Blessed One said:🔽“You might know, Susīma, you might know.”🔽Why is this said? In order to show that such knowledge arises even without concentration.

original: Ājāneyyāsi vātiādi kasmā vuttaṃ? Vināpi samādhiṃ evaṃ ñāṇuppattidassanatthaṃ. Idañhi
analyzed: ājāneyyā asi vā tiādi kasmā vuttam vinā api samādhim evam ñāṇa uppatti dassana attham idam hi
translated: For this is said:

original: vuttaṃ hoti – susima, maggo vā phalaṃ vā na samādhinissando, na samādhiānisaṃso,
analyzed: vuttam hoti susima maggaḥ vā phalam vā na samādhi nissandaḥ na samādhi ānisaṃso
translated: “The path and the fruition are not the outcome of concentration, they are not the fruit of concentration,

original: na samādhissa nipphatti, vipassanāya paneso nissando, vipassanāya ānisaṃso, vipassanāya🔽nipphatti, tasmā jāneyyāsi vā tvaṃ, na vā tvaṃ jāneyyāsi, atha kho dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇaṃ
analyzed: na samādhissa nipphatti vipassanāya pana iso nissandaḥ vipassanāya ānisaṃsaḥ vipassanāya  nipphatti tasmai jāneyyāsi vā tvam na vā tvam jāneyyāsi atha kho dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam
translated: they are not the result of concentration. But they are the outcome of insight, they are the fruit of insight,🔽they are the result of insight. Therefore you might know, or you might not know,

original: pubbe, pacchā nibbāne ñāṇanti.
analyzed: pubbe pacchā nibbāne ñāṇanti
translated: but knowledge of the stability of dhammas arises first, and knowledge of Nibbāna arises later.”

original: Idānissa paṭivedhabhabbataṃ ñatvā teparivaṭṭaṃ dhammadesanaṃ desento taṃ kiṃ maññasi,
analyzed: idāni issa paṭivedha bhabba tam ñatvā te parivaṭṭam dhamma desanam desento tam kim maññasi
translated: Now, knowing that he was capable of penetration, the Blessed One gave him a three-round teaching: “What do you think, Susīma,

original: susima? Rūpaṃ niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vātiādimāha? Te parivaṭṭadesanāvasāne pana thero
analyzed: rūpam niccam vā aniccam vā iti ādim āha te parivaṭṭa desanā avasāne pana thero
translated: “Is it form that is permanent or impermanent?” and so on. At the end of the round of questions, the elder

original: arahattaṃ patto. Idānissa anuyogaṃ āropento jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇanti, susima, passasītiādimāha.
analyzed: arahattam patto idānissa anuyogaṃ āropento jāti paccayā jarā maraṇanti susima passasi itiādim āha
translated: attained Arahantship. Now, in order to test him, the Exalted One asked, “Do you see, Susīma, that aging-and-death has birth as its condition?”

original: Api pana tvaṃ, susimāti idaṃ kasmā ārabhi? Nijjhānakānaṃ sukkhavipassakabhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: api pana tvam susimā ati idam kasmai ārabhi nijjhānakānam sukkha vipassaka bhikkhūnam
translated: Why did he begin with the question, “But, Susīma, do you see”?

original: pākaṭakaraṇatthaṃ. Ayañhettha adhippāyo – na kevalaṃ tvameva nijjhānako sukkhavipassako,
analyzed: pākaṭa karaṇa attham ayam ha ittha adhippāyaḥ na kevalam tvam eva nijjhānakaḥ sukkha vipassako
translated: In order to make clear to the bhikkhus who were dry-insight workers and were inclined to speculation

original: etepi bhikkhū evarūpāyevāti. Sesaṃ sabbattha pākaṭamevāti. Dasamaṃ.
analyzed: ete api bhikkhū evarūpāya iva ati sesam sabbattha pākaṭam eva ati dasamam
translated: that not only he but also these bhikkhus were of the same kind. The rest is clear in all sections. The tenth sutta.

original: Mahāvaggo sattamo.
analyzed: mahāvaggaḥ sattamaḥ
translated: The seventh sub-chapter is concluded.

original: 8. Samaṇabrāhmaṇavaggo🔽1. Jarāmaraṇasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: samaṇa brāhmaṇa vaggaḥ
translated: . The sub-chapter on ascetics and brahmins🔽. The exposition of the sutta on aging and death, etc.

original: 71-72. Samaṇabrāhmaṇavagge jarāmaraṇādīsu ekekapadavasena ekekaṃ katvā ekādasa suttāni vuttāni, tāni uttānatthānevāti.
analyzed: samaṇa brāhmaṇa vagge jarā maraṇa ādīsu ekeka pada vasena ekekam katvā ekādasa suttāni vuttāni tāni
translated: In the sub-chapter on ascetics and brahmins, eleven suttas are given, each beginning with a single term such as “aging and death,” “birth,” etc. These suttas are clear in meaning.

original: Samaṇabrāhmaṇavaggo aṭṭhamo.
analyzed: samaṇa brāhmaṇa vaggo aṭṭhamaḥ
translated: The eighth sub-chapter is concluded.

original: 9. Antarapeyyālaṃ
analyzed: antara peyya alam
translated: . The middle-length collection

original: 1. Satthusuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: . The exposition of the sutta on the Teacher, etc.

original: 73. Ito paraṃ “satthā pariyesitabbo”tiādinayappavattā dvādasa antarapeyyālavaggā
analyzed: itas param satthā pariyesitabba uti ādi naya ppavattāḥ dvādasa antara peyyāla vaggāḥ
translated: From here on there are twelve sections called “interwoven with the discourses” .

original: nāma honti. Te sabbepi tathā tathā bujjhanakānaṃ veneyyapuggalānaṃ ajjhāsayavasena
analyzed: nāma honti te sabbe api tathā tathā bujjhanakānam veneyya puggalānam ajjhāsaya vasena
translated: All of them are spoken in terms of the dispositions of those who are to be trained and who are awakening in this or that way.

original: vuttā. Tattha satthāti buddho vā hotu sāvako vā, yaṃ nissāya maggañāṇaṃ labhati,
analyzed: vuttā tattha satthā ati buddhaḥ vā hotu sāvakaḥ vā yam nissāya magga ñāṇam labhati
translated: Herein, a teacher is either a Buddha or a disciple, and he is one depending on whom one obtains the path knowledge.

original: ayaṃ satthā nāma, so pariyesitabbo. Sikkhā karaṇīyāti tividhāpi sikkhā kātabbā. Yogādīsu
analyzed: ayam satthā nāma so pariyesitabbaḥ sikkhā karaṇīyā iti tividhā api sikkhā kātabbā yoga ādīsu
translated: He is the “teacher” . He should be sought out. Training should be undertaken: the three trainings should be performed.

original: yogoti payogo. Chandoti kattukamyatākusalacchando. Ussoḷhīti sabbasahaṃ adhimattavīriyaṃ.
analyzed: yogo ti payogo chando ti kattu kamya tā kusala chando ussoḷhi iti sabbasaham adhimatta vīriyam
translated: In the case of the words yoga , etc., yoga is application. Chanda is the unwholesome desire to act. Usṣoḷhī is the utmost effort, which is the highest form of energy.

original: Appaṭivānīti anivattanā. Ātappanti kilesatāpanavīriyameva. Sātaccanti satatakiriyaṃ.
analyzed: anivattanā ātappanti kilesa tāpana vīriyam eva sātaccanti satata kiriyam
translated: Appaṭivānī is non-returning. Ātappam is energy that burns up defilements. Sātataṃ is constant practice.

original: Satīti jarāmaraṇādivasena catusaccapariggāhikā sati. Sampajaññanti tādisameva ñāṇaṃ.
analyzed: sati iti jarā maraṇa ādi vasena catu sacca pariggāhikā sati tādisam eva ñāṇam
translated: Satī is mindfulness that apprehends the four truths by way of aging-death, etc. Sampajañña is the corresponding knowledge.

original: Appamādoti saccabhāvanāya appamādo. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: appamādaḥ ti sacca bhāvanāya appamādaḥ sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati
translated: Appamāda is heedfulness in developing the truths. The rest is clear in all instances.

original: Antarapeyyālo navamo.
analyzed: antarapeyyālaḥ navamo
translated: The ninth interwoven text.

original: Nidānasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nidāna saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Nidana Samyutta is finished.

original: 2. Abhisamayasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: abhisamaya saṃyuttam
translated: The Absorption Connected Discourses

original: 1. Nakhasikhāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nakhasikhā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The First: The Tip of a Nail

original: 74. Abhisamayasaṃyuttassa paṭhame nakhasikhāyanti maṃsaṭṭhānena vimutte nakhagge.
analyzed: abhisamaya saṃyuttassa paṭhame nakhasikhāyanti maṃsa ṭṭhānena vimutte nakhagge
translated: In the first of the Absorption Connected Discourses, the “tip of a nail” is the nail-tip devoid of flesh.

original: Nakhasikhā ca nāma lokiyānaṃ mahatīpi hoti, satthu pana rattuppalapattakoṭi viya🔽sukhumā. Kathaṃ panettha paṃsu patiṭṭhitoti? Adhiṭṭhānabalena. Bhagavatā hi atthaṃ
analyzed: nakhasikhā ca nāma lokiyānam mahatī api hoti satthu pana  sukhumā katham pana ittha paṃsu patiṭṭhitaḥ ti adhiṭṭhāna balena bhagavatā hi attham
translated: And the tip of a nail is big for worldlings, but the Blessed One’s was fine like the tip of a red-lotus petal.🔽But how can earth be placed on it? By the power of resolve. For the Blessed One, who wanted to show the meaning, placed it there by the power of resolve.

original: ñāpetukāmena adhiṭṭhānabalena tattha patiṭṭhāpito. Satimaṃ kalanti mahāpathaviyā
analyzed: ñāpetu kāmena adhiṭṭhāna balena tattha patiṭṭhāpito satimam kalanti mahā pathaviyā

original: paṃsuṃ satakoṭṭhāse katvā tato ekakoṭṭhāsaṃ. Paratopi eseva nayo. Abhisametāvinoti🔽paññāya ariyasaccāni abhisametvā ṭhitassa. Purimaṃ dukkhakkhandhaṃ parikkhīṇaṃ pariyādiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: paṃsum sata koṭṭhāse katvā tatas eka koṭṭhāsam paratas pi esa iva nayaḥ abhisametāvino ti  paññāya ariya saccāni abhisametvā ṭhitassa purimam dukkha kkhandham parikkhīṇam pariyādiṇṇaṃ
translated: “A heap” is a heap of earth from the great earth made into a measure. The rest is as already stated.🔽“One who has penetrated” is one who has stood by penetrating the noble truths with understanding.

original: upanidhāyāti etadeva bahutaraṃ dukkhaṃ, yadidaṃ parikkhīṇanti evaṃ paṭhamaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: upanidhāya ati etat eva bahutaram dukkham yat idam parikkhīṇam ti evam paṭhamam vuttam
translated: “Having compared the first mass of suffering that has been exhausted and eliminated” is the first mass of suffering that has been exhausted and eliminated, having compared it thus “This is the greater mass of suffering that has been exhausted and eliminated.”

original: dukkhakkhandhaṃ upanidhāya, ñāṇena taṃ tassa santike ṭhapetvā upaparikkhiyamāneti
analyzed: dukkha kkhandham upanidhāya ñāṇena tam tassa santike ṭhapetvā upaparikkhiyamānā iti
translated: and he examines it by means of knowledge, placing it in juxtaposition to it.

original: attho. Katamaṃ panettha purimadukkhaṃ nāma? Yaṃ parikkhīṇaṃ. Katamaṃ pana parikkhīṇaṃ?
analyzed: attho katamam pana ittha purimadukkham nāma yam parikkhīṇam katamam pana parikkhīṇam
translated: What is the first suffering here? That which has already been exhausted. But what has been exhausted?

original: Yaṃ paṭhamamaggassa abhāvitattā uppajjeyya. Katamaṃ pana upanidhāya? Yaṃ sattasu🔽attabhāvesu apāye aṭṭhamañca paṭisandhiṃ ādiṃ katvā yattha katthaci uppajjeyya, sabbaṃ
analyzed: yam paṭhama maggassa a bhāvita ttā uppajjeyya katamam pana upanidhāya yam sattasu  atta bhāvesu apāye aṭṭhamam ca paṭisandhim ādim katvā yattha katthaci uppajjeyya sabbam
translated: That which would arise through the non-development of the first path. But what is placed in juxtaposition? That which would arise in seven existences

original: taṃ parikkhīṇanti veditabbaṃ. Sattakkhattunti satta vāre, sattasu attabhāvesūti attho.
analyzed: tat parikkhīṇam ti veditabbam sattakkhattunti satta vāre sattasu attabhāvesu iti attho
translated: beginning with the eighth rebirth in the seven kinds of abodes of beings, wherever it might arise. All that should be understood as already exhausted. Seven times at most: seven times, is the meaning.

original: Paramatāti idamassa paraṃ pamāṇanti dasseti. Mahatthiyoti mahato atthassa nipphādako. Paṭhamaṃ.🔽2. Pokkharaṇīsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: parama tā ti idam assa param pamāṇanti dasseti mahatthiyaḥ ti mahataḥ atthassa nipphādako paṭhamam 🔽pokkharaṇī sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The highest: this shows that this is the highest measure of it. Great benefit: the producer of great benefit.

original: 75. Dutiye pokkharaṇīti vāpī. Ubbedhenāti gambhīratāya. Samatittikāti mukhavaṭṭisamā. Kākapeyyāti sakkā hoti tīre ṭhitena kākena pakatiyāpi mukhatuṇḍikaṃ otāretvā pātuṃ. Dutiyaṃ.
analyzed: dutiye pokkharaṇī iti vāpī ubbedhena ati gambhīra tāya sama tittikā ati mukha vaṭṭi samā kākapeyyā ati sakkā hoti tīre ṭhitena kākena pakatiyā api mukha tuṇḍikam otāretvā pātum dutiyam
translated: In the second, a pool is a pond. As to depth: as to depth of water. As to breadth: as to breadth of surface. As to being drinkable by a crow: it is possible for a crow sitting on the bank to dip its beak naturally and drink. The second.

original: 3. Saṃbhejjaudakasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the verse of the water that has been stirred up, etc., is finished.

analyzed: tatiye yatthimā ati yasmin sambhijja ṭṭhāne imā saṃsandanti iti samāgantvā sandanti
translated: In the third, in whatever place: in whatever place where the water has been stirred up. They meet: they meet by coming together.

original: Samentīti samāgacchanti. Dve vā ti vāti dve vā tīṇi vā. Udakaphusitānīti udakabindūni.
analyzed: samenti iti samāgacchanti dve vā ti vā ati dve vā tīṇi vā udaka phusitāni iti udaka bindūni
translated: They mingle: they come together. Two or three: two or three. Drops of water: drops of water.

original: Saṃbhejjaudakanti aññāhi nadīhi saddhiṃ sambhinnaṭṭhāne udakaṃ. Catutthaṃ uttānatthameva. Tatiyacatutthāni.
analyzed: saṃbhejja odakanti aññāhi nadīhi saddhim sambhinna ṭṭhāne udakam catuttham uttānattham eva tatiya catutthāni
translated: Water that has been stirred up: water in a place where it has been mixed with other water. The fourth is self-evident. The third and fourth.

original: 5. Pathavīsuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the verse of the earth, etc., is finished.

original: 78-84. Pañcame mahāpathaviyāti cakkavāḷabbhantarāya mahāpathaviyā uddharitvā. Kolaṭṭhimattiyoti
analyzed: pañcame mahā pathaviyā ti cakkavāḷa bhantarāya mahā pathaviyāḥ uddharitvā
translated: In the fifth, having dug it up from the great earth: having dug it up from the great earth that is within the ocean. A lump the size of a kola or a rice grain:

analyzed: pada raṭṭhipamāṇā guḷikā ati mattika guḷikā upanikkhipeyya ati ekasmiṃ ṭhāne ṭhapeyya
translated: the size of a kingdom of a padara. A ball: a ball of clay. He should put it aside: he should place it in one place.

original: Chaṭṭhādīsu vuttanayeneva attho veditabbo. Pariyosāne pana aññatitthiyasamaṇabrāhmaṇaparibbājakānaṃ🔽adhigamoti bāhirakānaṃ sabbopi guṇādhigamo paṭhamamaggena adhigataguṇānaṃ satabhāgampi
analyzed: chaṭṭha ādīsu vutta nayena iva attho veditabbo pariyosāne pana añña titthiya samaṇa brāhmaṇa paribbājakānam  adhigamaḥ ti bāhirakānam sabbaḥ api guṇa adhigamaḥ paṭhama maggena adhigata guṇānam sata bhāgam pi
translated: The meaning should be understood in the way already stated in the case of the sixth and following jhānas. But at the end, the “attainment of the ascetics, brahmans, and wanderers of other sects” is the attainment of all the special qualities of the outsiders. Even a hundredth part of the special qualities attained by the first path is not to be found in them.

original: sahassabhāgampi satasahassabhāgampi na upagacchatīti. Pañcamādīni.
analyzed: sahassa bhāgam pi sata sahassa bhāgam pi na upagacchati iti pañcama ādīni
translated: The meaning should be understood in the way already stated in the case of the sixth and following jhānas. But at the end, “The attainment of the wanderers of other sects, brahmans, and contemplatives” is the attainment of all the special qualities of the outsiders. It does not amount to a hundredth part, or a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part of the special qualities attained by the first path. The fifth and following jhānas are to be understood in the same way. The description of the “Contemplation on Attainment” is ended.

original: Abhisamayasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Dhātusaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: abhisamaya saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  dhātu saṃyuttam

analyzed: dhātu saṃyuttassa paṭhame nissatta ṭṭha suññata ṭṭha saṅkhātena sabhāva ṭṭhena dhātu uti  laddha nāmānam dhammānam nānā sabhāvaḥ dhātu nānattam cakkhu dhātu uti ādīsu cakkhu pasādaḥ

original: Sotapasādo sotadhātu, saddārammaṇaṃ saddadhātu, sotapasādavatthukaṃ cittaṃ sotaviññāṇadhātu.

The consciousness that has nose-sensitivity as its material support is the nose-consciousness element.

translated: The tongue-sensitivity element is the tongue-sensitivity base. Flavour object is the flavour base. The consciousness that has tongue-sensitivity as its material support is the tongue-consciousness element.

original: Kāyapasādo kāyadhātu, phoṭṭhabbārammaṇaṃ phoṭṭhabbadhātu, kāyapasādavatthukaṃ cittaṃ🔽kāyaviññāṇadhātu. Tisso manodhātuyo manodhātu, vedanādayo tayo khandhā sukhumarūpāni
analyzed: kāya pasādaḥ kāya dhātu phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇam phoṭṭhabba dhātu kāya pasāda vatthukam cittam  kāya viññāṇa dhātu tisso manaḥ dhātuyaḥ manaḥ dhātu vedanā ādayo tayo khandhā sukhuma rūpāni
translated: The body-sensitivity element is the body-sensitivity base. Tangible-data object is the tangible-data base. The consciousness that has body-sensitivity as its material support is the body-consciousness element.

original: nibbānañca dhammadhātu, sabbampi manoviññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇadhātūti. Ettha ca soḷasa
analyzed: nibbānam ca dhammadhātu sabbam pi manaḥ viññāṇam manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu uti ettha ca soḷasa

And all the consciousness that is mind-consciousness is the mind-consciousness element.🔽And here the sixteen elements are of the sense sphere, and the last two are of four planes.🔽. The first.

original: dhātuyo kāmāvacarā, avasāne dve catubhūmikāti. Paṭhamaṃ.🔽2. Phassanānattasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kāma avacarāḥ avasāne dve  phassanānatta sutta vaṇṇanā

translated: So the meaning here is this: the first-impulsion contact arises with the mind element as its condition.🔽The second kind of contact is the second-impulsion contact associated with the registration that occurs in the mind door.🔽The third kind of contact is the third-impulsion contact associated with the adverting that occurs in the mind door.🔽The third kind of contact is the third-impulsion contact associated with the adverting that occurs in the mind door.🔽The fourth kind of contact is the fourth-impulsion contact associated with the registration that occurs in the mind door.🔽The fifth kind of contact is the fifth-impulsion contact associated with the adverting that occurs in the mind door.🔽The sixth kind of contact is the sixth-impulsion contact associated with the registration that occurs in the mind door.

translated: The seventh kind of contact is the seventh-impulsion contact associated with the adverting that occurs in the mind door.🔽The eighth kind of contact is the eighth-impulsion contact associated with the registration that occurs in the mind door.🔽The ninth kind of contact is the ninth-impulsion contact associated with the adverting that occurs in the mind door.🔽The tenth kind of contact is the tenth-impulsion contact associated with the registration that occurs in the mind door.

analyzed: tatiye no manaḥ samphassam paṭicca uppajjati manaḥ dhātu manaḥ dvāre paṭhama javana sampayuttam

analyzed: vedanānānatta sutta vaṇṇanā

analyzed: dutiya vedanā nānatta sutta vaṇṇanā  pañcame tatiya catutthesu ekato katvā iti dutiya ādīsu catūsu
